title: How to Make Your Own Coffee Single Bags

steps.headline: Take a single coffee filter 8-12 cup, and pour 1 1/2 tbsp coffee into the round bottom area.
Fold the coffee filter in half like a taco so that all the round edges meet, being careful to keep the coffee within the half-moon region that represents the circular bottom.
Fold the bottom right corner up over the front up and to the left as far as it will allow, then fold the bottom left corner up over the front and to the right as far as it will allow.
steps.description: The remaining edges of the coffee filter should stick up out of the center slightly flanged wide.

steps.headline: Fold the top right edge of the remaining filter down and to the left and the top left edge down and to the right so they bring the top of the filter to meet in the center.
steps.description: At this point the top of the filter may be slightly pointed.

steps.headline: Fold the top of the filter down once about 1/4" to create a flat edge instead of a pointed edge.
Fold the entire top down like an envelope flap to create a "satchel".
Finish by stapling through the folded top flap.
steps.description: If desired a string can be stapled to the satchel at the same time.

text: Take a single coffee filter 8-12 cup, and pour 1 1/2 tbsp coffee into the round bottom area.  Fold the coffee filter in half like a taco so that all the round edges meet, being careful to keep the coffee within the half-moon region that represents the circular bottom.  Fold the bottom right corner up over the front up and to the left as far as it will allow, then fold the bottom left corner up over the front and to the right as far as it will allow. The remaining edges of the coffee filter should stick up out of the center slightly flanged wide. Fold the top right edge of the remaining filter down and to the left and the top left edge down and to the right so they bring the top of the filter to meet in the center. At this point the top of the filter may be slightly pointed. Fold the top of the filter down once about 1/4" to create a flat edge instead of a pointed edge.  Fold the entire top down like an envelope flap to create a "satchel".  Finish by stapling through the folded top flap. If desired a string can be stapled to the satchel at the same time.
